Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Manny B
Reviews.Content: Rooms need updating, everything was awesome. This trip actually happened in April 2001

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inn in the heart of old town Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: BillyMaysHere
Reviews.Content: This inn was absolutely charming and furnished with period furnature (ca late 1930's). The location is perfect, the charm is wonderful. A word of warning, the front desk is only open betwixt 11AM and 7PM, but that should not be a problem. Lovely balconies provide a great oppertunity to sit outside and enjoy the sea air whilst watching the tourists walk by. Great hotel, and an outstanding value.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, Noise, Noise”
Reviews.Author: BigDx
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in the centre of town, that is noisy, this is for you. Location is good. Otherwise staff don't care (particularly management when I complained about the noise). I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but charming”
Reviews.Author: Rakshi
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, but clean and nicely furnished. The building has character, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable, but also small for two people. The location is extremely convenient. The hotel was quiet and the street noise not bad either, until a garbage truck came through early in the morning. We passed a comfortable and restful night, but for a longer visit, one might want a larger room. Be aware that Internet access is not free: there is a $10 charge per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find.”
Reviews.Author: ctraveller7
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy little Inn.. I booked day of on a third party website and was given a room here. Its located right in the downtown Lahaina area. Its associated with the Royal Lahaina Resort. There is complementary tea and coffee stand in the lobby. This Inn does not have elevator access so if you cant deal with dragging luggage up a stair case, you might want to go somewhere else, otherwise its only one flight and not much trouble. Parking is available up the street in a large parking lot. Has a restaurant and bar attached to it. The rooms are cozy and clean. The beds are a bit small but still comfortable. We attempted to sleep through the night in one bed, however ended up giving up and each sleeping in one. (room had 2 beds) The room had a nice balcony. I would stay at this property again, would recommend to someone looking for a great find on a low budget.

Reviews.Title: “Cute But... I Won't Go Back”
Reviews.Author: J_of_Annapolis
Reviews.Content: It is like one of those old family run European hotels with lots of old stuff, quaint decor, tiny rooms, etc.... but there is no family there. In fact, there was no staff of any kind most of the day. The desk clerk/manager left at 5 pm (the sign says the desk is staffed from 11am to 7 pm... go figure). So there was nobody to ask questions of. Finding the included parking was like a treasure hunt without a map, and parking is about a block away. I made my reservation for the Ocean Front Room with Economy Car deal. First, there are no ocean front rooms... you go out on your balcony, look right, and the ocean is a block away. Second, there was a screwup between the hotel and Dollar Rent A Car (and I may have done something wrong... there wasn't anybody to ask), so I ended up paying twice for my car... once to the hotel and once to Dollar. The person who answers the phone at customer service did not understand (or refused to understand) that there was any problem with that. The hotel is in the heart of Lahaina, a plus. But that means it is noisy until quite late. The rooms are very small, no closet, just two hooks on the wall. The double bed, a big pot plant, and a tall dresser take up most of the space in the room, not even a chair to sit on. The little deck was nice for two people to sit. The bathroom has a small shower, toilet, and small sink. It was clean though worn, and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place. So cute and clean.”
Reviews.Author: olliefied
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week and loved it. It's right downtown and close to everything. The staff was great and helpful. The rooms are small, but vey clean. I highly recommend a stay here, you will love the location. And for being so close to the main drag, it was suprisingly queit. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “It was cheap, quaint, and ok”
Reviews.Author: aa81j
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Lahaina Inn for 1 night. I enjoyed the oldness and uniqueness it provided. You are walking distance from the Lahaina strip where we spent most of our time in Maui any way. The price was alot better than $4500 a week at Honua Kai. If I was to return to Maui, I will definitely not over do it with the housing. We used the expensive hotel to eat, sleep, and take a dump. I can do that at Lahaina Inn and it 10X cheaper. You in Maui!!! Who care where you are staying, outside is way better than inside. Lahaina Inn change our way of thinking about these over priced hotels. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Fast”
Reviews.Author: crbarney
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for things happening downtown: shopping, eating, and boating trips. It can be noisy from 10:30pm til 1:00am because of people partying in the parking lot behind the hotel. And again the noise starts at 6:00am with the garbage trucks and the leaf blowers cleaning the in the parking lot. Your really don't need the sleep because there are so many fun things to do away from the hotel and nothing to do at the hotel other than sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: Joshua00
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay, but first since ownership changed, and will be our last time. There have been renovations, and for us the only upside of that was a nice redo on a bathroom. The downsides are plentiful. No closet in the room (#5), one dresser that was so mildewed that you could smell it coming into the room, so we had to live out of suitcases and hanging clothes on a hook on the wall. The room had no chair to sit in, no lighting except the overhead. Even the common area that was a nice feature in the past was gone, so no fridge to keep items in, no lounging area, no breakfast snacks, no board game area. The Lahaina Inn would be better described now as a fancy youth hostel, not a place to relax. Save your money, there are much better choices in Lahaina for less than what this place charges.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: morticia74
Reviews.Content: We love this place! Very laid back and friendly. We are not "high maintainence" guests, so this was perfect for us. Not for you if you expect someone to be at your beck and call. No ice machine, soda machine, etc, but a truly beautiful place. We would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Manners”
Reviews.Author: traveluk123456789
Reviews.Content: This hotel for the price is good value the other reviews are correct about the noise etc, but we did'nt find it to to disturbing' or the room size an issue. What I do object to is the manner of the only staff member that we have seen, a lady with short blonde hair. She is extermlely rude to the point of obnoxuois. So stay at the hotel if you do'nt mind being this spoken to by a grumpy staff me member. if the management fixed this problem it would be a four star for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and noisy - "how do they spell the word service?"”
Reviews.Author: Dodo052
Reviews.Content: Being our first time on Hawaii, we chose Maui as our central island, and Lahaina as our central spot for travelling the whole island of Maui by car. A great place! We chose the Lahaina Inn, as it has been recommended several times in the Internet. After having been there, we cannot quite follow such recommendations. We stayed there for 7 nights in the Mauka Suite. The word "Suite" is not just what we understand it was: just one normal room with a king-size bed and a balkonee. But ok. When choosing a hotel so centrally placed, one would not complaint about noise from bars around, or drunk people on the street, having fun. The trouble arouse the next morning: at exaktly 5:15 a.m. we were thrown out of the bed by a vulkanoe. It turned out to be the trash removal van, directly under our room. This was repeated every single following day - including Christmas - always between 5:15 and 6:00 a.m. The trash car was reliably followed by many other vans or trucks unloding stuff for the shops and restaurants neighboring Front St. So, at least we were early awake to start our aktivities over the island ... The front desk of the "Lobby", only be manned from 8 a.m. To 8 p.m., only very scarcely took note of us, when we were entering or leaving the hotel. A simple "How wre you?" was not granted. If you really have a problem - or simply a question - the front desk reverts you to the manager at the "Royal Lahaina Resort", 10 miles away, who is doing the management of the Lahaina Inn. After 7 nights, we had to move to the room next door, room #1, because when we made the reservation, the Mauka suite was already reserved over Christmas. Room #1, also facing to the front, towards Lahainaluna St., -and only having sight of a small part of the ocean, if you move your head by 90 degrees - is about half the size of Mauka suite, scarcely twice the size of the queen-size bed. And having the same problems with the noise as described for Mauka suite before. Plus: we have been "lucky" to neighboring a female couple in room #2, sitting on the balkonee of their room in the night both after midnight, as well as in the morning as just wakened by the trash removal at 5:15 a.m., and talking so loud, that we could literally understand every single word of their conversation. Internet: Wi-Fi is free one hour (which nobody told us), and then costs 9.95 $/day. Price: for 10 days (7 days Mauka suite and 3 days room #1) we paid over $ 1,800, including a car (economy) and paid parking. Conclusion: we shall definitely come back to Hawaii, but will certainly be more thoughtful, when chosing a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinTamTam
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few days in November, for $70 including tax you cannot go wrong. Going from a hostel room to a beautiful suite with a porch and a private washroom for $15 more with beautiful furniture... it was a dream come true! We knew for that price something had to be wrong with it and the next morning we discovered it was the noise in the morning, it starts at about 7:30 - 8 am and wakes you up for sure. So if you are looking to sleep in past 8 this place is not for you. If you're an early riser, THIS IS A TOTAL STEAL OF A ROOM. We are so lucky to have found such a beautiful room at this price.

Reviews.Title: “The garbage truck at 6 am is REALLY loud.”
Reviews.Author: ripresa
Reviews.Content: The best part about this place: Location & price. It's reasonably clean... could be cleaner though. There's that smell that old hotels tend to have. It was our first stop in our honeymoon, and we were jet-lagged. Hawaii is about 5 hours before us. So we had a hard time enough sleeping, without the really loud garbage truck in the morning. And we paid for the upgrade to get the ocean view. The noise is about 30 mins to 1 hour long. When I read the reviews online, I knew it was small, and I knew a garbage truck made noise in the morning. But I didn't realize it was that loud. You're there on your vacation. Sleep and rest are important. The noise is a deal-breaker, I will not be back to the Lahaina Inn.

Reviews.Title: “not a five star hotel but we had a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: stephtw76
Reviews.Content: cozy atomosphere, excellent location. small inn, 12 rooms and 2 suites i think. there's no in room tv available. but there's a lounge equipped with kitchen equipments (microwave oven, water dispenser, coffee maker, frige...etc) tv is there too. very helpful and friendly staff. great location.. the hotel is literally 2 mins away from front street. shopping center is 5 mins walk. there's a restaurant right downstairs " Lahaina Grill " (award winning joint), too bad we we kep t on missing trying it out. restaurant hours 6pm-10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina inn - a bit noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: WideEyedTravellers
Reviews.Content: We got a recommendation from Lonely Planet to stay at this old inn. It was quaint and clean. The bedroom was small but neat, we were only staying one night, so it was pretty trouble free. We heard nothing of other guests, so that was a bonus too. The trouble was, we heard the gentle roar of an air conditioner. I had broken sleep all night. I dont know exactly where it came from, but I suspect it was the air conditioners underneath and next door. So if you are a heavy sleeper, it is great. If you are a light sleeper, check the room out before you commit to it. Our room faced away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling Light”
Reviews.Author: CindyN3
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place to use as a base while driving around Maui!! I found the rooms clean and the balcony was a treat. I could hear the music from Cheeseburger's inthe evening but it wasn't intrusive, and I could watch the street wake up while I munched my granola for breakfast. Within walking distance of everything Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of the town, antique furnishings”
Reviews.Author: Lunasolhk
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spend one night in this Inn. The Inn is centrally located, easy access to everything. The room is a small one and with wodnerful antique furnishings plus with a nice ocean view balcony. Not easy to find a "free" parking in Lahaina and we even have problem to unload our baggage near the hotel. Highly recommand to park by where the Inn suggest you and its closer and not expensive. One small note, as the Inn located in the city centre and close to serveral bars, we did woke up by some drunk people scream at mid night and some big lorry parking/ loading in early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, well-run historic hotel, B&B-style, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on Maui, because we wanted to be in the middle of things in Lahaina. Previously, we'd spent a week in a mid-level condo, which cost about the same ($125/night). If you can do without hotel and condo amenities, the Lahaina Inn is a very relaxing and atmospheric, even romantic choice. My husband really enjoyed staying here among all the antique decor. The bed was wonderfully comfy, and the common room where you could make your own coffee and a simple breakfast that we brought along for ourselves was a welcome perk. The instructions for checking in after-hours (front desk not staffed after 5pm) were helpful. Best of all, we had a sunny open-air lanai with rocking chairs and an ocean view. A few downsides: * $7 per night for parking -- very affordable by Lahaina standards, but we hadn't known about it in advance. The parking lot has limited space for guests and is a half-block away. * Ample street noise until around 10:30pm. Radios thoughtfully provided in-room to cover up some of that noise, and the air-con added some white noise to the background. * No TVs, wi-fi, etc. (Some might consider this a perk, I realize, but if you have to stay connected to work, it can be an issue.) * Lots of "rules" signs everywhere you look in the room. (E.g., "Check-out time is no later than 11 a.m." on the bathroom mirror, instead of somewhere less obtrusive, like the back of the door.) The front desk manager was incredibly cool, and she did everything she could to make everyone's stay as pleasant as possible. The location in the middle of Lahaina town is fun. I don't think I would return, however, since for the same price I could instead book a one-bedroom condo in Honokowai or Kihei and get more space, amenities and use of a swimming pool. The Lahaina Inn is romantic, but it's just not as well-equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifly restored period hotel in heart of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I wanted to be in downtown Lahaina for a short while. The Inn was perfect. The Inn is simple and centrally located--perfect as a launching point for Lahaina activities: scuba, surf lessons, bars and restaurants. The small beautifully restored rooms have comfortable beds. Spring the extra bucks for an ocean view balcony. Tori, the Inn Keeper was a font of helpful information. Very friendly. Three notes: 1. If you want TV, you'll be disappointed. It's in the common guest area along with the refrigerator. For me, well, I didn't come to Maui to sit in my room and watch TV. 2. Parking is $7/night. This is super cheap by Lahaina standards, but it's good to know about in advance. 3. The desk closes at 5 PM. After that you're pretty much on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what i was looking for”
Reviews.Author: hayden11
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this place. Quaint would be the perfect word. Stayed in resort for first 5 days, which was nice, but Lahaina Inn has a homey feel. It is like going back in time. Was greeted by Melinda, who was super friendly & gave off a good vibe. The owner, Tony (female) was there working on a saturday, and she also was very nice and helpful, she even stopped and gave me a ride when she saw me walking! Place is very clean. I stayed in room closest to Front st, which was awesome. I sat on the lanai in my rocking chair, listening to the tunes coming from Cheeseburger in Paradise while watching the sunset. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdmStudent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Lahaina Inn for 2 nights on our honeymoon and had a great time. On arrival we were offered a great deal to upgrade to a suite so we did. To get to the rooms you have to go up fairly narrow stairs (so if mobility is a problem this probably isn't the place for you) but the rooms and upstairs are older style but beautiful. The staff were very friendly. All in all, if you don't have mobility problems and you're looking for a relatively inexpensive, and really a very nice place to stay on Maui, Lahaina Inn is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Cute clean spot right in the middle of town”
Reviews.Author: smoothdude
Reviews.Content: We were flying standby and booked at the Lahaina Inn the night we got into Maui. We got a great rate through Trip Advisor (I believe it sent us to a link at hotels.com) so that worked out nicely. The rooms are small and if you want the quieter room go for the side facing away from the main street, although there's no view. The view is nicer out on the porch on the street near the ocean, but I'm sure it could get a bit noisy esp on weekends..as there are people around.. If we stayed again though we'd probably take that main street view as we sat out on our little porch a few times in rocking chairs..and it would have been nice to have a better view than a parking lot. There's no breakfast but they have coffee for you and fridge and tv to use.. no AC either so keep that in mind if you go during a hot month (we just went during Christmas so the weather was cool enough at night). The rooms are decorated with an antique motif.. we had a beautiful armoire in our room that I liked using. The innkeeper was also quite friendly and helped us arrange for another night we decided to stay at a nearby B&B (because Lahaina was already booked that night). Overall I would recommend it.... do you research for a good rate though like we did, as that definitely helped. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home - 50 Years ago”
Reviews.Author: December29
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Lahaina Inn is much like going back in time 40-50 years. And, this includes the friendly, neighborly hospitality and helping hand that we were accustomed to back then. If you are looking for a resort stay with all the extras or if you like condo style where you can cook, lie around, read and watch t.v., this place is not for you. However, if you need a very clean, downtown place for a few days, close to everything and plan to be on the road more than in your room, you will like it here. Parking is about 1-1/2 blocks away and the daily charge placed on your room bill is nominal. I was particularly impressed with the owners and staff at the Inn. They do whatever is required to address any issue you have right down to loading your luggage in your car for you. They seem to really care about their visitors and want you to be happy there. I enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay is OK”
Reviews.Author: Volocty
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation to Maui and we stayed at the Lahaina Inn for 1 night. It is a small quaint hotel in the heart of Lahaina. We did not expect much, just a nice clean place to rest for the night, and we were not disappointed. The hotel and rooms are very simple and small (room #1), which adds to it's charm and uniqueness. We sat on the balcony and just people watched. I would not want to stay there for more than a few days, just because it's just too small. The hotel staff and guests were all friendly and very helpfull. There is a common eating room or parlor, which gives you the opportunity to meet and talk to some of the other folks staying in the hotel, kind of reminds me of an old Inn that would be more common in Europe or just in earlier times. Overall, a nice place to stay, but don't have big expectations, this is not your current resort style hotel (and that's a good thing). Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Cozy, Really Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: dallastx44
Reviews.Content: Lahaina is a very unique little town anyway, and the Lahaina Inn fits perfectly with its surroundings. Very old, filled with anitiques, centrally located in the heart of of the little harbor town of Lahina. Late night check in consists of an envelope in your name on the front desk. If you want room service or personalized service, this is not the place for you. If you want to spend some time in a quaint, comfortable hotel with lots of history in an excellent location, then try Lahaina Inn. We also dined at Lahaina grill adjacent to the hotel which was very convenient. The rooms are clean and well decorated as well as the rest of the Inn. Filled with antiques and history, we spent some time "reading the walls" as well as enjoying our view of the harbor/ocean. It is in downtown so sleeping with the windows open is only an option if the noise from the street doesn't bother you. It gives you that "old west" feeling. We had late check in and early check out, so although it was easily done, we never had any contact with the staff. Overall, it was a very pleasant, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Inn a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: junglemike
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Inn was a pleasant surprise as we were expecting the worst based upon reviews here, those people should have stayed at one of the characterless mega resorts elsewhere. Stepping into the lobby was like stepping back in time, rustic and charming. The staff was always happy to offer info and very easy going. The rooms are small but comfortable, you don't come to Maui to spend time indoors or watch tv. And it was right in the middle of Lahaina which made it convenient. We would definitely return if in Maui again!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and comfortable ;)”
Reviews.Author: serenefyredancer
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Inn is absolutely beautiful. Very quiet and very romantic. First trip to Maui with my fiance and we could not have picked a better place to stay. We booked the Makai suit which is bigger than the others and had a day bed in it. If you have a love for antiques then you will fall in love with this hotel. We sat on the balcony in the rocking chairs many nights and could hear live music being played in the distance and we could see the water. Only once did we see another couple on their balcony so we had quiet romantic time. I rent luxery condo's on Kauai and have stayed many places but this one was my favorite! The maids came everyday to leave towels and make our bed. There was central air conditioning which was a huge plus. We will be back every year and wouldn't stay anywhere else! I am completely satisfied with my stay at the Lahaina Inn ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if you don't need a chain”
Reviews.Author: trgvideo
Reviews.Content: First off, this is not the Four Seasons and you are not paying for the 4 Seasons. The affordable hotel is perfect for those on a budget and do not require high maintenance. You will not be able to call the front desk after 7pm, but again, this is not a chain hotel. My wife and I bought a fifth of vodka, plugged in our iPod and went to the nearby Safeway to make our own Happy Hour before we hit the town. The room is clean, and I have yet to see a bug. Although if Jack Niclolson come running down the hall screaming "All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy", I might not be surprised. If you require the amenities of the 4 Seasons, then open up your wallet and pay their rate. This is a simple, quaint, yet, quite frankly, romantic place to stay. High maintenance people need to stay at the Marriott.. Those if us adventerous can sustain a place like the Lahaina Inn. If you don't like 2 stars... then PAY for higher stars... Lahaina Inn is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Local but thats it.”
Reviews.Author: Kyfu262000
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from staying in here and let me tell you the location is great! Half a block from Front street, which means easy access to the all the bars which is great late at night, no getting into your car after a few. However that is just about it. When we checked in we were told they didn't have the type of room we booked, all that was left in the price range we booked was a room with two twin beds that were too heavy to move. So we paid to upgrade to a double bed in a very tiny room. We were also told we could park in a lot just up the street. Great except they didn't tell us we were going to be paying for it. Not that 7 bucks a day is bad in Lahaina but it would have been nice to know upfront. Over all if you don't care about having a small dank feeling room this is a good place to stay. (please read as: if you are never going to be in your room than this is a good place to stay) If you want some alone time or if you go out late and want to sleep past 6 than I would find a nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay before boaring a boat”
Reviews.Author: chicagolouis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room #6 which was small and the ac did not work too well. The room had been redone, and the bathroom was nice. woke up and walked to the Molokai ferry at 7:15. Good location for seeing Lahaina, but the room is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Lahaina activities base”
Reviews.Author: inSF
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay for your N and West side activities. The only place that was less than $150 and no minimum night stays. Yes the room was small, the the common fridge was the smallest dorm fridge you could find, but it was right in the middle of town. Stayed 2 nights to drive North and take a Trilogy sailing tour, so not that much time in the room. Central air keeps the place cool and the desk people are cool too. Common room was good for our morning cereal- Foodland and everything is w/in few blocks away. Wouldn't stay too long here, our stop between Molokai and a Wailea resort. AM noise does start at 7am, but hey I was awake anyways. Parkin $7/day a block away.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get ripped off, then stay here!”
Reviews.Author: manatee181
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation with the Lahaina in for February of 2008 April 27th of this year. Subsequently, my husband and I have had an economic hardship and had to cancel six weeks after we booked. The Inn feels it is necessary to charge an outrageous cancellation fee of $150 even thought they have ample time to rebook the property. I tried to resolve this nicely with the inn by offering to pay any charges they might have incurred by processing our reservation but they felt the need to keep all of the $150. It is in dispute with the credit card company and it is illegal to charge excessive cancellation fees and then rebook. I should have checked this website before booking, the feedback speaks for itself! Don't book with these guys!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small, noisy but good location”
Reviews.Author: campchick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I did a crazy amount of research before we went to Maui. This was the most expensive place we stayed. That being said, we were kind of disappointed. The Inn is lovely, like an old hotel in New Orleans, but our room was like a shoe box. No place for our bags, and the air conditioner was broken, it was either on full blast which dropped to 61 degrees, or not at all. Normally this wouldn't have been a problem, but our neighbors liked to smoke on their lanais, which in turn blew into our room's open windows... you get the idea. Plus, because you are right in the heart of Front St. you get the noise. We had no problem at night, but it was terrible in the morning. Jackhammers and trucks beeping, and not at 9 AM, this was before 7 AM! So because we had found so many cheap gems throughout Maui, this turned out to be an unnecessary "splurge". We probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Inn”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter16
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Lahaina Inn in January. It's a very cute place just steps from Front Street (the main drag). The rooms are cozy and well appointed with balconies and antique furniture. The room we had was fairly large in size with views of Front Street and the ocean from the balcony. The bed was comfortable and the washroom was nice with a wonderful shower. There is free internet in the main room (if you bring a computer). There are no TVs in the guest room (but there is one in the main room). If you're planning on staying in Lahaina, I would recommend staying here. I highly recommend eating at David Paul's (the restaurant connected to the hotel but not part of the hotel). It's pricey but very well worth it! The food was excellent and the service was fabulous. If you plan on eating there I would make a reservation as this a popular restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Bottom Line”
Reviews.Author: MTTDMAN
Reviews.Content: I read all the other reviews and then felt compelled to write one myself. Let me clarify a few things - the room I stayed in was small. and there was no TV. My bags occupied a lot of space in the room. As this wasn't a traditional hotel I was used to, I wasn't sure I would enjoy it. But I did, very much. I stayed three nights. The room, as I indicated was small, but it was very comfortable. A/C kept the room nice and cool and the bed was great. You're close to everything in Lahaina - restaurants, shops, supermarket, movies, and the beach are all right there. As for the TV, if you really need to watch TV to feel comfortable, there's one in the common room. But seriously, you're in Hawaii, in a great town, right on the edge of the water. Instead of watching TV, I went out and walked around and explored the area. Much better than watching another sitcom re-run. In the later evening, I read, or checked out the internet on the wireless connection, or watched one of the many DVD's I had with me. Seriously, I didn't miss the TV at all. I could keep up with news on my laptop, and watch DVD's or youtube. NBC has whole epsiodes of their shows on the website NBC 24/7. I just don't get the whole freak out about not having a TV to watch. It's sort of a sad commentary. (Then again, try and take my laptop form me...) It was a little loud in the AM with service trucks beeping and clanging, but I was already up - so it's only a problem if you sleep past 9 AM. (You're in Hawaii, why would you?) There's also an iron and ironing board, and beach towels, and radios for use on the beach. The staff was very hospitable - I forgot something when I checked out and less than an hour later I had a phone call telling me so. I also locked myself out, and got great service solving that dilemma. Overall, it was very comfortable, and a GREAT change of pace from an overpriced chain hotel (which I stayed in a week or so prior to my stay here.) I stayed three nights and if I could have, I would rented a room here for a month, It was great, I'm glad to have had the opportunity for the experience. So long story short, if freak out about not having a TV and room service, there are plenty of more expensive options ten miles away. But if you can think outside the box and would love a comfortable room in the middle of everything, choose the Lahaina Inn, and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Quicky and all the better for it.”
Reviews.Author: BenjiS
Reviews.Content: Booked into one of the suits - what a wonderful room. Lovely old furniture that gives the hotel a refreshingly different vibe. Really glad we avoided the big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inn just off Maui's busy Front Street”
Reviews.Author: Maureen_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Inn is a great place to stay overall in Maui for short trips (3 nights or less) if you are traveling as a couple or alone. It has character and is half a block away from Front Street where the restaurants and shops are spiling with tourists. If you are arriving after 5pm like we did, let the hotel know. You'll be given a door code to get in and you'll find an envelope at the front desk with your room key and welcome letter. The two rooms we had during this trip (stayed one night, travelled to other islands and then came back for 3 nights) were cramped but we didn't worry about it too much because they were clean and had charming antique decor. The bonus is the balcony that you get facing the street because of the added space to sit and the view of the water to your right and the mountain to your left. There is a living room type area in the hotel where you can make coffee or sit and watch tv. They have beach mats and a couple other things for guests to use if you're going to the beach. The parking lot is about a block away and the rate just gets charged to your room fee. Downsides: the area is quite noisy from the people coming off Front Street well into the night. There isn't a hotel attendant on site after 5pm so if you need an extra towel or something you're hooped. The lighting in our first room wasn't the greatest, in fact both lamps didn't work so we only had the overhead and hall light. Our one complaint was having the housekeeper not clean our room one morning so we came back in the evening to an unmade room and no towels and had to wait until 8am to get them. That's a one off thing so I won't hold it against them! Generally speaking it's fine, good location being in the heart of the tourist area so you can walk rather than drive and it's clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Better Location”
Reviews.Author: NAPILIBAY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august 06 in one of the larger rooms and it was a great room plenty of room for 2 people and even 1 child. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Would stay here again. Great location in the heart of Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK...”
Reviews.Author: IreneATL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lahaina inn for 3 nights. It was an interesting experience but it is definitely not a place for everybody - you will either love it or hate it. For myself, I would have chosen another accommodation option if I were to do it again. I will try to be as objective as possible and here are some pointers: Pros: 1. I think Debbi is friendly and helpful. On the day of check-in she actually tried to carry our luggage to our rooms even though we had 3 guys in our group! 2. I was under the impression that it will have no TV, but I was pleasantly suprised that there was a TV in the community room with all the cable channels you need. They even provide high-speed internet access (you have to bring your own laptop). My group hangs out mostly in the community room, chatting, making tea, watching TV, checking email and looking at photos we took. There are other guests coming into the community room occasionally and they are all very nice and friendly people. I think it is the best part of the whole experience. We stayed in 2 different places after this and I missed the community room. 3. It is in the heart of the Lahaina town, with all the restaurants, shops and galleries you need. We eat and walk around town until 9pm without needing to think about time. You really don't get that if you stay in Kihei. Cons: 1. My friends and my husband both experienced ant problems. My husband found many ants inside his computer bag during our stay and he was very upset. My friend also found ants in her candy that she had in her bag. 2. I loved antiques but I totally forgot about the scent it brings. The inn has a cinnamon-like smell that usually comes from older houses and furniture but personally I am not fond of. My friends didn't seem to have a problem with it though. You should test yourself first by going to a real antique store or an older house and see if you can stand that smell before booking the hotel. 3. I also find the room a bit small and I wish the bed was a bit more comfy. The mattress does feel like it is from the 70s or earlier, which you could say it goes with the theme. I wish they could consider switching to modern day mattress so you can get the modern comfort even though it is fitted in an antique bed frame.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have definitely learned our lesson about the word "cozy". My husband and I could not even fit our suitcases into the room; we literally had to rearrange the furniture to create enough walking room. So tiny! Also, there were no "antiques" to speak of. The staff were not very friendly at all. We ended up leaving and staying in Hana for two days, despite the fact that we were already locked into paying for our rooms at the Inn. It was the best decision of our honeymoon, if we had to stay in that room for 6 straight nights I would NOT have been happy. I will definitely write to Fodor's and tell them this inn should NOT be recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Last time I stay anywhere billed as "cozy" or "quaint"”
Reviews.Author: sittinongo
Reviews.Content: To be fair we usually stay at chain hotels so this was new for us. We got into town later than we expected and the parking was down the street from the Inn. When we got to the Inn, it was locked up and we had to use a code to get in since everyone had gone for the day. We had to carry all of our luggage up the stairs and when we got to our room it was so tiny, I couldn't believe it. The website did indicate cozy but I expected a little more room. We had just enough room to get around the bed in single file due to the large antique furniture although I am pretty sure the bed was a double. The bathroom was really small too with just a shower and nowhere to put out all of our toiletries so we kept almost everything in the suitcases. Also due to the antiques everything smelled really musty to us and the wood floor felt sticky the whole time we were there I am sure because we were near water but it was still an unpleasant feeling so we kept flip flops on any time we got out of bed. The room was not furnished to encourage staying in it because it was so small. I enjoyed being out on the balcony and didn't mind the people on the street. It did remind us of the French Quarter which we like. When I was in the room I was out there because I felt like I could actually breathe, however, we had to be careful going out because the door knob kept falling off and the only comment we got on that was "Well, it is an antique". We had requested this specific room based on a review in a travel book saying how romantic it was and how great the view was. We were in Hawaii to renew our wedding vows for our 25th anniversary so we had arranged to stay there for 3 days as opposed to 2 days on Oahu and we paid more per night than the other hotel. I have to say that I was disapointed but again I have never stayed in this type hotel before. I am fairly certain we will never stay in one again. The chain hotels are predictable at least.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the inn. We stayed in a smaller room the first couple of nights, but moved to a larger room, (an ocean view suite). It was great. The smaller rooms are really nice, and have beautiful antique furniture. The suite was very comfortable. We sat on the balcony in the evening and watched people on Front Street. The best part was, they did not know we were up there. All of the rooms are on the 2nd floor and there is no elevator, but the front desk staff assisted us with our luggage. While we were there, there was a gal with a cane and even though she walked slow, she was able to get up and down the stairs. The community room is nice. There is one TV, but most people are gone at night. We had coffee each morning and would take it to our room. One of the best places for breakfast is the Gazebo in Napili. It is about a 15 minute drive from Lahaina, but it was really good. We are looking forward to our next vacation in Maui and will stay there again. The prices are really good, especially compared to the bigger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely won't go back”
Reviews.Author: jessiet1023
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights. After the first night, considered leaving early, but didn't out of inertia and fear that we would fail to find another place and/or not get a refund. (they said we could if they were able to rent it.) The room was very small. The bed was creaky each time we rolled over- did not allow for a good night's sleep! Shower only, no tub. Worst of all, they ran out of hot water our first morning. (other guests had the same experience.) When we let them know, the woman at the desk told me repeatedly why they shouldn't have. On the plus side, she got right on the phone to have someone take a look, but kept telling me why it shouldn't be a problem. Never once did she say anything about being sorry for the inconvenience, etc. She also said it's only happened once before in 2 years. (I think that was the frequency? i wasn't all that impressed with the track record.) The porch was nice access to the outdoors, but as noted in other reviews, not peaceful. We very much regretted the choice and will definitely not do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Mlounc
Reviews.Content: We love to spend the first part of our Maui trip in Lahaina for the atmosphere, shopping. We stayed three nights and found the Inn to be very clean and well-kept, cozy and private, prime location. The innkeepers very friendly and helpful. The lanai with rocking chairs was wonderful. We'll definitely stay there again. Only one problem that is beyond the control of the innkeepers is the garbage trucks each morning starting at 5:30 am......you are in the middle of a busy town.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lahiana Inn for 5 nights in August. What an incredible experience! The 2 women who own it were so courteous and helpful, the rooms are furnished with beautiful antiques and very clean. Last but not least the lanais have quaint little rocking chairs we sat in while drinking our morning coffee watching the boats come in and out of the harbor. It's within walking distance to everything. We will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice little inn in a fun place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Lahaina Inn twice in the last five years and found it comfortable and convenient, especially for the price in such a popular area. It is unfortunate that breakfast ws discontinued and I hope they will correct that or stop advertising it as a B&B. The breakfast was only a continental breakfast, but Hamburger Heaven is just across the street on the water and a great place to enjoy the morning. We would go back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Lahaina Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 127 Lahainaluna Rd., Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
